Bridges had a good taste for pictures.  He had a small but choice collection by the Old Masters, which he kept arranged in the warehouse under his shop. I remember being present in his warehouse with my father when a very beautiful small picture by Richard Wilson was under review.  Davie burst out emphatically with, "Eh, man, did ye ever see such glorious buttery touches as on these clouds!"  His joking friends clubbed him "Director-General of the Fine Arts for Scotland," a title which he complacently accepted.
